bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. William C. Swartz. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p:
Territory of Washington Spokane County}ss
To any constable and the Keeper of the jail of said County Whereas William Swartz has been brought before the undersigned one of the justices of the peace in and for said county charged on the oath of A Reading with having on the 7th day of July 1885 in said county committed the offence of feloniously stealing taken and carried away one certain red line back cow the property of James Ralph of the value of Thirty five dollars and upon the examination thereof it appearing to the said Justice that the said offence had been committed and that there is probable cause for charging the said William Swartz with having committed said offence the said Justice required the said William Swartz to give bail in the sum of five hundred dollars for his appearance to answer at the next term of the District Court whereas the said William Swartz has failed to give the bail as required by me Therefore in the name of the United States you are hereby commanded with the necessary and proper assistance forthwith to convey and deliever and you the said
keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said William Swartz into your custody in the said jail and him there safely keep unless he be discharged by due cause of law
Given under my this 9th day of July 1885 O.F. Wood Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington vs William Swartz

Commitment
Filed this 9th day of July 1885 O.F. Wood JP
